Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fluctuation \Fluc`tu*a"tion\, n. [L. fluctuatio; cf. F. fluctuation.] 1. A motion like that of waves; a moving in this and that direction; as, the fluctuations of the sea. [1913 Webster]
2. A wavering; unsteadiness; as, fluctuations of opinion; fluctuations of prices. [1913 Webster]
3. (Med.) The motion or undulation of a fluid collected in a natural or artifical cavity, which is felt when it is subjected to pressure or percussion. --Dunglison. [1913 Webster]

fluctuation n 1: a wave motion; "the fluctuations of the sea" 2: an instance of change; the rate or magnitude of change [syn: {variation}] 3: the quality of being unsteady and subject to fluctuations; "he kept a record of price fluctuations" [syn: {wavering}]
